item.title: Cloudflare mitigates new record-breaking 22.2 Tbps DDoS attack
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Cloudflare has mitigated a distributed denial-of-service (DDoS) attack that peaked at a record-breaking 22.2 terabits per second (Tbps) and 10.6 billion packets per second (Bpps). [...]

item.title: CISA says hackers breached federal agency using GeoServer exploit
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: CISA has revealed that attackers breached the network of an unnamed U.S. federal civilian executive branch (FCEB) agency last year after compromising an unpatched GeoServer instance. [...]

item.title: Police dismantles crypto fraud ring linked to €100 million in losses
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Law enforcement authorities in Europe have arrested five suspects linked to a cryptocurrency investment fraud ring that stole over €100 million ($118 million) from more than 100 victims. [...]

item.title: 5 ways to streamline Identity Governance with this free tool
item.dc:creator: Sponsored by tenfold Software
item.description: Identity Governance doesn't have to be complex or costly. tenfold's free Community Edition helps orgs (up to 150 users) streamline onboarding, access reviews & M365 permissions — all with a no-code IGA platform. [...]

item.title: SolarWinds releases third patch to fix Web Help Desk RCE bug
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: SolarWinds has released a hotfix for a critical a critical vulnerability in Web Help Desk that allows remote code execution (RCE) without authentication. [...]

item.title: SonicWall releases SMA100 firmware update to wipe rootkit malware
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: SonicWall has released a firmware update that can help customers remove rootkit malware deployed in attacks targeting SMA 100 series devices. [...]

item.title: GitHub tightens npm security with mandatory 2FA, access tokens
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: GitHub is introducing a set of defenses against supply-chain attacks on the platform that led to multiple large-scale incidents recently. [...]

item.title: NPM package caught using QR Code to fetch cookie-stealing malware
item.dc:creator: Ax Sharma
item.description: Newly discovered npm package 'fezbox' employs QR codes to hide a second-stage payload to steal cookies from a user's web browser. The package, masquerading as a utility library, leverages this innovative steganographic technique to harvest sensitive data, such as user credentials, from a compromised machine. [...]

item.title: Airport disruptions in Europe caused by a ransomware attack
item.dc:creator: Ionut Ilascu
item.description: The disruptions over the weekend at several major European airports were caused by a ransomware attack targeting the check-in and boarding systems. [...]

item.title: American Archive of Public Broadcasting fixes bug exposing restricted media
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: ​A vulnerability in the American Archive of Public Broadcasting's website allowed downloading of protected and private media for years, with the flaw quietly patched this month. [...]

item.title: Automaker giant Stellantis confirms data breach after Salesforce hack
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Automotive manufacturing giant Stellantis has confirmed that attackers stole some of its North American customers' data after gaining access to a third-party service provider's platform. [...]

item.title: New EDR-Freeze tool uses Windows WER to suspend security software
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A new method and proof-of-concept tool called EDR-Freeze demonstrates that evading security solutions is possible from user mode with Microsoft's Windows Error Reporting (WER) system. [...]

item.title: Microsoft lifts Windows 11 update block after face detection fix
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Microsoft has removed a compatibility hold that prevented devices with integrated cameras from installing Windows 11 24H2 due to a face detection bug causing app freezes. [...]

item.title: Mozilla now lets Firefox add-on devs roll back bad updates
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Mozilla has announced a new feature that enables Firefox extension developers to roll back to previously approved versions, allowing them to quickly address critical bugs and issues. [...]
